intro: Tanarius spinosus, commonly known as the spiny tanarius, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
